(H. ) 133) to the Cabinet with the following recommendations(a) That Sir Miles Lampson should be askedto show a copy of the Committee1s Report in confidence to Sir Arthur Salter on his arrival in China (which he- was visiting at the request of the Chinese Government) and to inform Sir Arthur that His Majesty's Government would be glad if he would furnish them with a statement of his-views on the recommendations contained, in the Committee's Report and, generally, On the question of foreign loans to China;(b) That further action on the Committee^Report, should be deferred until a reply has been received from Sir Arthur S alter.-;(c) That the Foreign Office should inform' Sir Charles Addis privately of the action proposed to be taken-.* * * *
